content.text: 1001.1 Scope: Covers materials and installation requirements for traps, interceptors, and separators.
1002.1 Fixture traps: Each fixture must have a separate trap; limitations on vertical (24") and horizontal (30") distances from outlet to weir.
1002.2 Design: Traps must be self-scouring and corrosion-resistant. Slip joints only on inlet, outlet, or within the trap seal.
1002.3 Prohibited traps: Moving part traps, bell traps, S traps, crown-vented traps, drum traps (except solids/chemical), and partition-reliant traps.
1002.4 Trap seals: Liquid seal must be 2"–4"; deeper for special needs fixtures.
1002.4.1 Trap seal protection: Includes potable, reclaimed, gray, wastewater primers, barrier devices, or shared drain connections.
1002.5 Sizing: Traps must match drainage needs and not exceed the size of the drainpipe.
1002.6 Building traps: Prohibited.
1002.7 Trap setting: Must be level and protected from freezing.
1002.8 Recesses: Underground traps (e.g., bathtubs) must be vermin- and corrosion-proof.
1002.9 Acid-resistant traps: Brittleware traps must be encased in 6" concrete.
1002.10 Mental health centers: No exposed pipes or traps.
1003.1 Where required: Prevent discharge of hazardous or harmful materials into the sewer.
1003.2 Approval: Type, size, and location must be approved and meet code.
1003.3 Grease interceptors: Must be used in commercial kitchens; prohibited for food disposers.
1003.3.1 Required fixtures: Includes dishwashers, pot sinks, hood wash, wok stations, etc.
1003.3.2 Disposers not allowed: Must not be connected to grease interceptors.
1003.3.3 Additives: Only microbes permitted; chemicals/enzyme dosing is prohibited.
1003.3.4 Residential: Interceptors not required in private living quarters.
1003.3.5 Hydromechanical interceptors: Must follow ASME, CSA, PDI specs and be installed per instructions.
1003.3.5.1 Sizing: Refer to Table 1003.3.5.1 – gpm → grease retention capacity in lbs.
1003.3.5.2 Flow control: Must be vented and not exceed rated flow.
1003.3.6 Automatic grease removal: Must be sized per flow and allow access for maintenance.
1003.3.7 Gravity interceptors: Sizing = peak flow × 30 minutes. Must meet IAPMO/ANSI Z1001 or ASME A112.14.6.
1003.3.8 Direct connection: Required to sanitary drainage.
1003.3.9 On-site systems: Required for high grease-producing kitchens; connected before septic system.
1003.4 Oil separators: Required at garages, car washes, factories, elevators unless alarm present.
1003.4.1 Liquid separation: Must handle varying specific gravities.
1003.4.2 Design: Depth ≥2 ft, water seal ≥18 in. Garage units scaled by floor area.
1003.5 Sand interceptors: Must allow cleaning and have ≥6" water seal.
1003.6 Clothes washer interceptor: Required unless in dwelling units. Basket required for >1/2" debris.
1003.7 Bottling plants: Must intercept solids like broken glass.
1003.8 Slaughterhouses: Must prevent discharge of feathers, entrails, or clogging debris.
1003.9 Venting: Must be vented per Chapter 9 to avoid air binding.
1003.10 Access and maintenance: Must allow for grease/oil/scum removal.
1004.1 General: Must conform to Chapter 4 and Chapter 7, and be free of obstructions to flow.
